abstract: Mirinaba cadeadensis (Morretes, 1952), a strophocheilid land snail, is known from Morro Cadeado, Estrada da Graciosa and Pico Marumbi, all located in the Atlantic Rainforest biome along the coast of Paraná state, Brazil. Based on material from the collection of the Museu de História Natural Capão da Imbuia (Curitiba, Brazil) and newly collected specimens, we report the occurrence of this species in 11 new localities in this region.
